sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"特殊的，特别的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: special, especial, specific, particular, exceptional, extraordinary, peculiar
means: special ： 普通用词，指不同于一般、与众不同，着重事物的专门性，突出与一般不同。
especial和special含义很接近，较正式，但侧重有特殊的意义或重要性。
specific ： 着重指某种、某类事物具有的特殊或特定的属性，也可指专门提出作特别考虑的事物。
particular ： 侧重不同于普遍性的个性或特殊性。
exceptional ： 指不同于一般，本身是特别的或异常的事物。
extraordinary ： 语气比exceptional强，指极大地超过一般或正常情况。
peculiar ： 强调指与众不同或独特的意思。

sentence.Network_en: We are taught to construe these terms in a particular way.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们被教导要以特定的方式理解这些词语。

sentence.Network_en: Republican strategists are taking particular aim at Democratic senators.
sentence.Network_cn: 共和党的战略家正尖锐地攻击民主党的参议员。

sentence.Network_en: A particular source of contention is plans to privatise state-run companies.
sentence.Network_cn: 发生争执的一个根源就是国营公司的私有化方案。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French particuler, from Latin particularis 'concerning a small part', from particula 'small part'

entry.def: You use particular to emphasize that you are talking about one thing or one kind of thing rather than other similar ones.

example.ex: I remembered a particular story about a postman who was a murderer...
example.tran: 我记得有个故事，讲的是一个邮递员杀人的事情。

example.ex: I have to know exactly why it is I'm doing a particular job.
example.tran: 我必须明确知道我为什么要做特定的一项工作。

entry.def: If a person or thing has a particular quality or possession, it is distinct and belongs only to them.

example.ex: I have a particular responsibility to ensure I make the right decision...
example.tran: 我肩负特殊责任，必须确保自己作出的决定是正确的。

example.ex: Fatigue is a particular problem for women.
example.tran: 疲劳是女性特有的问题。

entry.def: You can use particular to emphasize that something is greater or more intense than usual.

example.ex: Particular emphasis will be placed on oral language training.
example.tran: 将会特别强调口语训练。

entry.def: If you say that someone is particular, you mean that they choose things and do things very carefully, and are not easily satisfied.

example.ex: Ted was very particular about the colors he used.
example.tran: 特德在用色上非常讲究。

entry.def: You use in particular to indicate that what you are saying applies especially to one thing or person.

example.ex: The situation in Ethiopia in particular is worrying...
example.tran: 埃塞俄比亚的局势尤其令人担忧。

example.ex: Why should he notice her car in particular?...
example.tran: 他为什么会特别注意到她的车？

entry.tran: 没什么重要（或特别）的事物（或人）
entry.def: You use nothing in particular or nobody in particular to mean nothing or nobody important or special.

example.ex: I went along thinking of nothing in particular only looking at things around me...
example.tran: 我一路走着，没想什么特别的事，只是四下张望着。

example.ex: Drew made some remarks to nobody in particular and said goodbye.
example.tran: 德鲁说了一些不针对任何人的话就告辞了。

means.word_mean: 1. a fact about some part (as opposed to general);

sentences.sentence: "he always reasons from the particular to the general"

means.word_mean: 2. a small part that can be considered separately from the whole;
1. unique or specific to a person or thing or category;

sentences.sentence: "has a paraticular preference for Chinese art"
"a peculiar bond of sympathy between them"

means.word_mean: 3. separate and distinct from others of the same group or category;

sentences.sentence: "a man who wishes to make a particular woman fall in love with him"

means.word_mean: 4. surpassing what is common or usual or expected;

sentences.sentence: "a matter of particular and unusual importance"
"a special reason to confide in her"
"she gets special (or particular) satisfaction from her volunteer work"
"very particular about how her food was prepared"

auth_sentence.content: But one fan in particular has enjoyed global attention.
auth_sentence.res_content: But one fan in particular has enjoyed global attention.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But one fan in particular has enjoyed global attention.

auth_sentence.content: Recupero points out two hardware management technologies in particular.
auth_sentence.res_content: Recupero points out two hardware management technologies in particular.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Recupero points out two hardware management technologies in particular.

auth_sentence.content: It was a particular voice, a familiar voice.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was a particular voice, a familiar voice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was a particular voice, a familiar voice.

stems_affixes.word_buile: a=ad+part部分,分开→向另一部分→分别地, 分离的
de分开+part部分,分开→部分分开→离开
im无+partial有偏见的→无偏见的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不可给予的, [律][土地,产业等]不能分割的
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+part部分,分开+ible能……的→不能分成部分

stems_affixes.value_cn: 部分的,不完全的;偏袒的,不公平的,偏爱的
stems_affixes.word_buile: part部分,分开+ial……的→adj.部分的,不完全的;偏袒的,不公平的,偏爱的
part部分,分开+icular有……的→有自己部分的→特别的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分离, 分成零件, 分别地, 分离着
stems_affixes.word_buile: a=ad+part部分,分开→向另一部分→分别地, 分离的
particular特殊的+ly表副词→adv.独特地, 显著地
part部分,分开+ly表副词→adv.部分, 几分
a+part部分,分开+ment具体物→楼房分出的一部分→公寓
counter相反+part部分→反面一样的部分→对应人物
de向下+part部分,分开+ment表名词→下面的部分→部门,系
part部分,分开→n.部分, 局部 v.分开

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粒子,微粒;极小量;小品词,虚词
stems_affixes.word_buile: part部分,分开+icle小东西→小部分→少量
part部分,分开+icular有……的→有自己部分的→特别的
parti=party党,一部分人+san人→党人→党徒
part部分,分开+ition表名词→[分成]部分

stems_affixes.value_cn: 合作者,合伙人,合股人,伙伴,舞伴,配偶
stems_affixes.word_buile: part部分,分开+n+er人→n.合作者,合伙人,合股人,伙伴,舞伴,配偶

stems_affixes.value_cn: 党, 政党, 随行人员
stems_affixes.word_buile: part部分,分开+y人→n.党, 政党, 随行人员
de分开+part部分,分开→部分分开→离开
im进入+part部分,分开→进入知识的一部分→传授
part部分,分开→n.部分, 局部 v.分开
part部分,分开+take拿→拿一部分→partake分享,参与

stems_affixes.value_cn: 参与,参加;分享,分担;含有,带有
stems_affixes.word_buile: parti=part部分+cip抓+ate表动词→抓住成为一部分→参与

Sentence.sentence: Learning to express ideas well in both writing and speech, knowing how to find information, and knowing how to do research are all solid background skills for a wide variety of roles, and such training is more important than any particular major in a liberal arts college.
Solid background knowledge in a particular field
The woman is too particular about food.
The second question is "How can I assess the investment risk of a particular bond issue
But Oprah's particular brand of celebrity is not a good fit for the values of a university whose motto(座右铭),Veritas,means truth
Reinforcement occurs when we receive direct or indirect rewards or punishments for particular gender role behaviors.

means.word_mean: 特殊的, 特别的, 特有的

sentences.en: This is a particular account of the accident.
sentences.cn: 这是一份全面而详尽的事故报告。

sentences.en: The doctor had been particular in examining her.
sentences.cn: 医生对她进行了仔细的检查。

means.word_mean: [常作复数] (消息或情报等的)详情；细目

sentences.en: Your mother must be anxious to know the particulars.
sentences.cn: 你的母亲一定急于了解详情。

jushi.english: You should do it with particular care.
jushi.chinese: 你做这件事时要特别小心。

jushi.english: It happened on that particular day.
This game holds no particular interest for me.
jushi.chinese: 这种游戏我觉得并不特别有趣。
